title: Look Up
focus: Cultivating intimacy with God through practices that engage body, mind, and spirit.
description: Focus your gaze upward toward God—explore His presence, voice, and invitation in your life.

reflectionQuestions.prompt: Describe your current prayer life: posture, environment, mental focus, and any physical rhythms.
How do you engage Scripture—reading aloud, memorization, lectio divina—and what supports you physically and mentally?
In corporate worship and community, how do your emotions and thoughts align with communal song and prayer?
How often do you practice silence or solitude, and what bodily posture or space aids your listening?
What fasting or simplicity practices have you tried, and how did your body and mind respond?
How does serving others outside your formal role feed your spirit and affect your physical and emotional well-being?

tasks.description: Recommit to one discipline this week; journal daily body sensations, thoughts, and spiritual insights.
Schedule a half-day retreat: include guided meditation, a scripture walk, and silent reflection.
Attend a new worship or service event; note emotional responses and spiritual takeaways.
Try a 24-hour simplicity fast; record physical challenges and spiritual breakthroughs.

followUpPrompts.prompt: Which practice most engaged your body, mind, and spirit?
What did you learn about God’s presence through these rhythms?
How will you integrate that discipline into your ongoing formation?
